alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Forsyth and northeastern Davidson Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winston-Salem, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Wind gusts of this magnitude are capable of knocking down large tree branches that may pose a risk to your life. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, Lewisville, Pfafftown, Sedge Garden, Stanleyville and Welcome. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
